intro: Eriosema stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriosema, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, also known as the legume or bean family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. It typically grows in grassland habitats and is often found in areas with well-drained soils. Eriosema stenophyllum is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
